data.title: Bob Hoskins remembered fondly by the stars
data.meta_description: Celebrities ranging from Samuel L. Jackson to Hugh Jackman are remembering the late actor
data.text:
Tributes are pouring out for Bob Hoskins who has died at age 71.

The actor, who starred in "Who Framed Roger Rabbit?" and "Mona Lisa," died in a hospital after a bout of pneumonia. He had been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease nearly two years ago.

Celebrities ranging from Samuel L. Jackson to Charlize Theron and Hugh Jackman are remembering the late actor. See what they have to say:

Lauren Moraski

Lauren Moraski is managing editor of entertainment at CBSNews.com
